text:
World U.S. Orders Slowdown of Refugee Resettlements State Department temporarily suspends work on cases involving refugee travel to the U.S. scheduled for after March 3 By @Abihabib Feb. 16, 2017 3:37 p.m. ET 
The U.S. State Department has ordered embassies to slow resettlement of refugees for the next few weeks and temporarily suspend it completely after March 3 as the numbers approach the annual cap of 50,000 set recently by President Donald Trump, according to American officials. 
U.S. officials from embassies in the Middle East said they received a directive on Tuesday from the State Departmentâ€™s Population, Refugee and Migration bureau to immediately suspend travel to the U.S. for refugees awaiting final resettlement after...
